channel.title: Basic Text to Binary and vise versa Converter
channel.description:
This is a basic little conversion program i made... only converts A-z and 0-9
Actually its the first program i've gotten to work on other peoples computers... I usually have a problem compileing into a jar...
Plz Comment

item.title: Basic Text to Binary and vise versa Converter
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Unless you’re releasing a program you plan on selling or something like that then you should always release the source with it.
The program may look great, and work great but with the source people could find errors in you’re code help you with them, in the end making it work better, and look better?

Oh, and it saves us decompiling it :rolleyes:.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Text to Binary and vise versa Converter
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

That type of loop is a foreach loop. I use them whenever I don’t need the int created by old-fashioned for loops (for(int i = 0; i < num; i++)) (e.g. I need to store something into an array etc.). And about the problem you’re having, I haven’t been able to recreate it. Perhaps you could try to, and post what you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Basic Text to Binary and vise versa Converter
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

Actually White Castle,

I was looking for some method that would do it automatically, like Integer.toBinaryString(), like you posted. But… sadly, I could not find one. So I decided to go the hard way.

Anyway thanks for the post and next time I will post Source.

Oh… btw I’ve never seen this:

for(char c : str.toCharArray())

Mind explaining? my guess… c is = to str in a Char array…
but then you go in each time and add c to the String Buffer… one char at a time…

(I already know for(int i = 30; i>0;i++) … ect.)

Edit {

Sadly your code did not work… … tested it on an online converter… came out all weird… and f’ed up… or maybe its just the online one… idk…

Here is the source code… see if you can help me out… also… i still need something to convert it back to text…

item.title: Basic Text to Binary and vise versa Converter
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Not bad for a beginning project, especially with a GUI. However, the way you convert text to binary is a little sketch (see: unnecessarily complex). You could do something like this, and this way you’re not limited to A-z0-9:

public String texttobinarym(String ttbs) { StringBuffer binary = new StringBuffer(); for(char c : ttbs.toCharArray()) binary.append(Integer.toBinaryString(c)); return binary.toString().trim(); }

Also, one of the conventions of the Java programming section is to actually post source, not just a jarfile with the classes. This way, people can analyze the inner workings of your program, and perhaps even give you advice (as I have, although I had to decompile ;)).

Read full topic
item.source: Basic Text to Binary and vise versa Converter
